topic: How to document stream processing using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to document stream processing using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Documenting Stream Processing Using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to document stream processing using FastAPI, a modern web framework for building APIs, in Python 3.12+.
key_points: Leverage the power of FastAPI's OpenAPI 3.0 for documenting APIs
Stream processing support in FastAPI using ASGI and WebSockets
Use Pydantic models to validate input data
Integrate Uvicorn as an ASGI server for running the application

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI, WebSocket
app = FastAPI()

@app.websocket('/ws/{client_id}')
def ws(websocket: WebSocket, client_id: str):    # Stream processing example...

from fastapi import FastAPI, Response, UploadFile, File,
    Depends
from pydantic import BaseModel
class InputData(BaseModel):    # Pydantic model example...

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is the minimum required version.
FastAPI v0.74.0 or later for OpenAPI 3.0 support.
Uvicorn v0.16.0 or later as an ASGI server.
caveats: Be aware that this guide focuses on stream processing and may not cover all aspects of FastAPI
Ensure your environment has the necessary packages installed (FastAPI, Uvicorn, etc.)
